intro: Jasminonerium africanum, commonly known as the African jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, orange fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soil and full sun. Jasminonerium africanum is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
